text: <@U0KM61BCP>: We have installed "ci-skip" plugin but related changes are not pushed yet. Will submit patch today..
how is ci skip related to jdk?
Not related.. I mentioned about ci-skip only..
JDK, dependency packages are not installed properly.. Could be related to some network issue. Checking this further..
I don't see that error in running builds. Will check further and let you know the update on failed builds with JDK error

Hi <@U0KM61BCP> and <@U0UHG4VP1>, this is Smita from Power Software development. We have a Power node that we would like to include in the community CI. Ramesh mentioned that I should talk to you. Please let me know what the requirements are for the VM and if I can set it up and include it in the list of slaves for daily builds. Thank you!
you need to work with <@U11HH3P7Y> and <@U0UHG4VP1> (who is on holiday this week)
Ok..I got the document from Ramesh regarding Gerrit and Linux Foundation account etc
<@U11HH3P7Y> please let me know if you could help me while <@U0UHG4VP1> is on vacation.
Sure I can help you.
Thank you
<@U12V3D2P2> : I don't have access to Jenkins Master.. We can ask <@U1BC5NF2S> to add power node..
Ok, getting the node ready for local builds, once that's done I will contact <@U1BC5NF2S>

Also, we have to add one more job for power in ci-management repo <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/gitweb?p=ci-management.git;a=tree;f=jjb/fabric;h=4532cc504c90a19caee5741339978d1cc370cdcf;hb=refs/heads/master>
<@U11HH3P7Y> this is another one of those sporadic failures that I see (across branches)
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/668/console>
<@U0UKTPMG8> is looking into this..
<@U1BC5NF2S> are you around? have some Jira questions/asks
<@U0KM61BCP> Ask away. :slightly_smiling_face:
1. is there a way that we can define components
or is that something we need to ask you or ry?
also, setting sprints and story points to track and calculate velocity
<@U0KM61BCP> By components do you mean Jira projects? Or is that an issue field..
there is a Component field but none defined, and seems like I need admin privs to create them
if you open Create issue, it is between Summary and Description
currently reads “none"
I can get a list of components and that would help keep things organized better than labels (which can get unwieldy)
<@U1KDHJT6H> can get a list, I should say;-)
<@U1KDHJT6H|claytonsims> has joined the channel

<@U0KM61BCP> Ah, I understand. Can you access this page: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/FAB/components> I added you to 'administrators' for the project. I'm wondering if setting you as the Project Lead does not imply those permissions...
I can see that, could not before
thanks
<@U0KM61BCP> No problem! Send a list of who should be able to administer which projects to <mailto:helpdesk@hyperledger.org|helpdesk@hyperledger.org> and I'll get things fixed up.
<@U1KDHJT6H> for starters
looks like I can create a sprint (yay) and add components (yay)
nice,
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U1KDHJT6H> has been added as well.
thanks!
<@U0KM61BCP>: ci-skip is working now.., We can skip build using [ci skip] in commit message..
